gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: GT10 - Spctrl_Absp from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:abstract.gco:CharacterString: spectral absorption coefficients of phytoplankton Dataset Description: <p>Phytoplankton spectral absorption coefficient (ap) from surface samples collected on Whatman, 2.5cm&nbsp; glass fiber filters (GFF). Samples were collected during Geotraces 2010 (kn199-04).</p><p>The following metadata was extracted from the header information from each file. Where necessary the information was incorporated into BCO-DMO metadata fields or retained in file (* and X represent file-specific values):<br /><br />/begin_header&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/affiliations=NASA_SSAI&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/investigators=Aimee_Neeley Joaquin_Chaves&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/contact=aimee.neeley@nasa.gov&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/experiment=Geotraces&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/cruise=kn199-4&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/station=10&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/data_file_name=F06_St*_AP.csv&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/documents=F06_log.csv&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/calibration_files=SeaBASS_NDFilter.pdf&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/data_type=scan&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/north_latitude=XX.XXX[DEG]&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/water_depth=NA&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!COMMENTS&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!Samples were collected in duplicate using a peristaltic pump at the surface. Samples were collected in conjunction with AOP package deployments &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!Duplicate samples are being reported here (rep numbers are in the field name)&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!Samples were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!See SeaBass_NDFilter.pdf for explanation of fields&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!See F06_log.csv for metadata&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />!&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/missing=-999&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; <br />/delimiter=comma&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;</p> Acquisition Description: <div>The following information was obtained from file headers and via correspondence with PIs:</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>Samples were collected in duplicate, using a peristaltic pump at the surface and were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters.&nbsp; Samples from station 1 were collected with WHOI's GEOTRACES pump.&nbsp; Sample numbers for stations &gt; 1 were collected with NASA's surface peristaltic pump.&nbsp; Samples were collected in conjunction with AOP package deployments.&nbsp;</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>See Processing Description for a link to additional information.</div><div>&nbsp;</div><p>&nbsp;</p>

gmd:credit.gmx:Anchor: Funding provided by National Aeronautics & Space Administration (NASA) Award Number: NNX09AN94G

gmd:otherConstraints.gco:CharacterString: Access Constraints: none. Use Constraints: Please follow guidelines at: http://www.bco-dmo.org/terms-use Distribution liability: Under no circumstances shall BCO-DMO be liable for any direct, incidental, special, consequential, indirect, or punitive damages that result from the use of, or the inability to use, the materials in this data submission. If you are dissatisfied with any materials in this data submission your sole and exclusive remedy is to discontinue use.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: GEOTRACES is a SCOR sponsored program; and funding for program infrastructure development is provided by the U.S. National Science Foundation.GEOTRACES gained momentum following a special symposium, S02: Biogeochemical cycling of trace elements and isotopes in the ocean and applications to constrain contemporary marine processes (GEOSECS II), at a 2003 Goldschmidt meeting convened in Japan. The GEOSECS II acronym referred to the Geochemical Ocean Section Studies To determine full water column distributions of selected trace elements and isotopes, including their concentration, chemical speciation, and physical form, along a sufficient number of sections in each ocean basin to establish the principal relationships between these distributions and with more traditional hydrographic parameters;* To evaluate the sources, sinks, and internal cycling of these species and thereby characterize more completely the physical, chemical and biological processes regulating their distributions, and the sensitivity of these processes to global change; and* To understand the processes that control the concentrations of geochemical species used for proxies of the past environment, both in the water column and in the substrates that reflect the water column.GEOTRACES will be global in scope, consisting of ocean sections complemented by regional process studies. Sections and process studies will combine fieldwork, laboratory experiments and modelling. Beyond realizing the scientific objectives identified above, a natural outcome of this work will be to build a community of marine scientists who understand the processes regulating trace element cycles sufficiently well to exploit this knowledge reliably in future interdisciplinary studies.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: BCO-DMO catalogue of parameters from GT10 - Spctrl_Absp from the U.S. GEOTRACES NAT project of the U.S. GEOTRACES program

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32380.rdf Name: wavelength Units: nm Description: Wavelength (between 300-800nm) at which spectrophotometric scans were performed, with a 1nm data interval and 2nm Slit Band Width (SBW). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32381.rdf Name: abs_ap_1 Units: dimensionless Description: Raw particulate absorbance measurement (no null correction). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32382.rdf Name: abs_ap_1_sd Units: dimensionless Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of particulate absorbance measurements. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32383.rdf Name: abs_ad_1 Units: degrees Celsius Description: Raw detrital absorbance measurement of first replicate (no null correction). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32384.rdf Name: abs_ad_1_sd Units: dimensionless Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of detrital absorbance measuremenst. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32385.rdf Name: diameter_1 Units: mm Description: Diameter of sample biomass on filter. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32386.rdf Name: volume_filtered_1 Units: ml Description: Volume filtered; samples were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32387.rdf Name: ap_1 Units: 1/m Description: Total particulate absorption coeffient (null correction included). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32388.rdf Name: ad_1 Units: 1/m Description: Detrital absorption coefficienct (null correction included). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32389.rdf Name: aph_1 Units: 1/m Description: Phytoplankton absorption coefficient (Aph = Ap - Ad). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32390.rdf Name: abs_blank_sd Units: dimensionless Description: Standard deviation of absorbance of all blank filters measured throughout the analysis period. Note: files that contain both replicates and more than one column of blank error indicates that replicates were analyzed on different days. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32391.rdf Name: abs_ap_2 Units: dimensionless Description: Raw particulate absorbance measurement (no null correction). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32392.rdf Name: abs_ap_2_sd Units: dimensionless Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of particulate absorbance measurements. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32393.rdf Name: abs_ad_2 Units: dimensionless Description: Raw detrital absorbance measurement of first replicate (no null correction). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32394.rdf Name: abs_ad_2_sd Units: dimensionless Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of detrital absorbance measuremenst. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32395.rdf Name: diameter_2 Units: mm Description: Diameter of sample biomass on filter. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32396.rdf Name: volume_filtered_2 Units: ml Description: Volume filtered; samples were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32397.rdf Name: ap_2 Units: 1/ Description: Total particulate absorption coeffient (null correction included). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32398.rdf Name: ad_2 Units: 1/m Description: Detrital absorption coeffient (null correction included). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32399.rdf Name: aph_2 Units: 1/m Description: Phytoplankton absorption coefficient (Aph = Ap - Ad). http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32400.rdf Name: abs_blank2_sd Units: dimensionless Description: Standard deviation of absorbance of all blank filters measured throughout the analysis period. Note: files that contain both replicates and more than one column of blank error indicates that replicates were analyzed on different days. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32403.rdf Name: station Units: dimensionless Description: Unique station identifier. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32540.rdf Name: lat Units: decimal degrees Description: Latitude component of geographic position where samples were collected. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32541.rdf Name: lon Units: decimal degrees Description: Longitude component of geographic position where samples were collected. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32542.rdf Name: time_gmt Units: hhmm Description: Time of sampling, reported in GMT. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32543.rdf Name: date_gmt Units: yyyymmdd Description: Date, recorded in GMT time. http://lod.bco-dmo.org/id/dataset-parameter/32544.rdf Name: depth Units: meters Description: Sample depth in meters.

gmd:title.gco:CharacterString: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:citedResponsibleParty.xlink:title: GB/NERC/BODC > British Oceanographic Data Centre, Natural Environment Research Council, United Kingdom

gmd:otherCitationDetails.gco:CharacterString: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LATX/ Name: LATITUDE Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/LONX/ Name: LONGITUDE Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest. http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/P09/current/DEPH/ Name: DEPTH BELOW SEA SURFACE Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:descriptor.gco:CharacterString: PI-supplied Description: Wavelength (between 300-800nm) at which spectrophotometric scans were performed, with a 1nm data interval and 2nm Slit Band Width (SBW).; General Description: The distance between two successive peaks of an electromagnetic radiation wave.
PI-supplied Description: Raw particulate absorbance measurement (no null correction).; General Description: The fraction of radiant flux absorbed (at a specific wavelength).
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of particulate absorbance measurements.; General Description: Standard deviation of absorbance measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Raw detrital absorbance measurement of first replicate (no null correction).; General Description: The fraction of radiant flux absorbed (at a specific wavelength).
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of detrital absorbance measuremenst.; General Description: Standard deviation of absorbance measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Diameter of sample biomass on filter.; General Description: Diameter of sample biomass present on sample filter, measured using digital calipers.

PI-supplied Description: Volume filtered; samples were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters.; General Description: volume of water filtered; in this form generally applies to the volume of water filtered during plankton tows; however; this parameter name is also used for a variety of non plankton sampling and the units can vary, e.g. US JGOFS EqPac Bishop MULVFS sampler vol_filt is reported in liters.

PI-supplied Description: Total particulate absorption coeffient (null correction included).; General Description: The fraction of incident flux which is absorbed, divided by the thickness of the medium layer.

PI-supplied Description: Detrital absorption coefficienct (null correction included).; General Description: The fraction of incident flux which is absorbed, divided by the thickness of the medium layer.
PI-supplied Description: Phytoplankton absorption coefficient (Aph = Ap - Ad).; General Description: The fraction of incident flux which is absorbed, divided by the thickness of the medium layer.

PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of absorbance of all blank filters measured throughout the analysis period. Note: files that contain both replicates and more than one column of blank error indicates that replicates were analyzed on different days.; General Description: Standard deviation of absorbance measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Raw particulate absorbance measurement (no null correction).; General Description: The fraction of radiant flux absorbed (at a specific wavelength).
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of particulate absorbance measurements.; General Description: Standard deviation of absorbance measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Raw detrital absorbance measurement of first replicate (no null correction).; General Description: The fraction of radiant flux absorbed (at a specific wavelength).
PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of 3 filter rotations of detrital absorbance measuremenst.; General Description: Standard deviation of absorbance measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Diameter of sample biomass on filter.; General Description: Diameter of sample biomass present on sample filter, measured using digital calipers.

PI-supplied Description: Volume filtered; samples were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters.; General Description: volume of water filtered; in this form generally applies to the volume of water filtered during plankton tows; however; this parameter name is also used for a variety of non plankton sampling and the units can vary, e.g. US JGOFS EqPac Bishop MULVFS sampler vol_filt is reported in liters.

PI-supplied Description: Total particulate absorption coeffient (null correction included).; General Description: The fraction of incident flux which is absorbed, divided by the thickness of the medium layer.
PI-supplied Description: Detrital absorption coeffient (null correction included).; General Description: The fraction of incident flux which is absorbed, divided by the thickness of the medium layer.
PI-supplied Description: Phytoplankton absorption coefficient (Aph = Ap - Ad).; General Description: The fraction of incident flux which is absorbed, divided by the thickness of the medium layer.

PI-supplied Description: Standard deviation of absorbance of all blank filters measured throughout the analysis period. Note: files that contain both replicates and more than one column of blank error indicates that replicates were analyzed on different days.; General Description: Standard deviation of absorbance measurement.
PI-supplied Description: Unique station identifier.; General Description: consecutive station number

PI-supplied Description: Latitude component of geographic position where samples were collected.; General Description: latitude, in decimal degrees, North is positive, negative denotes South; Reported in some datasets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance north or south from the equator, measured along the meridian of the point of interest.

PI-supplied Description: Longitude component of geographic position where samples were collected.; General Description: longitude, in decimal degrees, East is positive, negative denotes West; Reported in some datsets as degrees, minutes NERC Description: The angular distance east or west east or west of Greenwich to the point of interest.
PI-supplied Description: Time of sampling, reported in GMT.; General Description: time of day, reported in GMT time, 24 hour clock

PI-supplied Description: Date, recorded in GMT time.; General Description: gmt month, day and year, usually as a text string, e.g. feb10_1995. It is better to use one of the other forms of presenting date and time data so that the data can be used in computations and for comparisons. Note, if the string begins with numbers but also includes letters, there may be problems using the field name for retrieval.

PI-supplied Description: Sample depth in meters.; General Description: observation/sample depth, in meters; best estimate; usually but not always calculated from pressure; calculated either from CTD pressure using Fofonoff and Millard (1982; UNESCO Tech Paper #44) algorithm adjusted for 1980 equation of state for seawater (EOS80) or simply equivalent to nominal depth as recorded during sampling if CTD pressure was unavailable NERC Description: The distance of a sensor or sampling point below the sea surface.

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmd:description.gco:CharacterString: <div>The following information was obtained from file headers and via correspondence with PIs:</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>Samples were collected in duplicate, using a peristaltic pump at the surface and were filtered under vacuum (~5-7psi) onto combusted GF/F filters.&nbsp; Samples from station 1 were collected with WHOI's GEOTRACES pump.&nbsp; Sample numbers for stations &gt; 1 were collected with NASA's surface peristaltic pump.&nbsp; Samples were collected in conjunction with AOP package deployments.&nbsp;</div><div>&nbsp;</div><div>See Processing Description for a link to additional information.</div><div>&nbsp;</div><p>&nbsp;</p>

<p>For sample processing information and methodology, see associated <a href="http://bcodata.whoi.edu/US_GEOTRACES/AtlanticSection/neeley_chaves/SeaBASS_NDFilter.pdf">SeaBASS documentation file</a>.&nbsp;</p><p><b>BCO-DMO Processing notes:</b></p><p>Edits made:<br />- Parameter header names were edited to conform to BCO-dMO convention<br />- Blank data fields were edited to 'nd'<br />- Edited time to remove colons and drop unused seconds <br />- Edited precision of lat/lon to four decimals.<br />- Edited precision of absorbance, and respecctive absorbance standard deviation <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; and absorption coefficient data to 8 decimals.<br />- Added columns for 'diameter' and 'volume_filtered' (previously in metadata log file)<br />- Removed the comment information from file headers. Where<br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; necessary the information was incorporated into BCO-DMO <br />&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp; metadata fields and retained entirely in Dataset Description.</p><p><b>Note</b>:&nbsp; The variable &quot;abs_blank_sd&quot; corresponds to standard deviation data for station 7 only, when sample processing spanned two days (abs_blank_sd was calculated at the end of each day).&nbsp; This parameter is displayed as 'nd' for all other stations where all processing was completed in one day.<br /><br />Definitions of parameter name components obtained from PI:</p><ul> <li>ap=total particulate absorption</li> <li>ad= detrital absorption</li> <li>aph= phytoplankton absorption</li> <li>ap-ad=aph</li></ul><p><br />Correspondence with the Co-PI on 2013.01.12, necessitated editing the header note indicating NASA's pump.&nbsp; Therefore, this comment retained in the header has been edited to the following text:</p><p>#samples from station 1 were collected with WHOI's GEOTRACES pump<br />#sample numbers for stations greater than 1 were collected with NASA's <br /># surface peristaltic pump</p><p><b>Additional GEOTRACES Processing:&nbsp; </b>After the data were submitted to the International Data Management Office, BODC, the office noticed that important identifying information was missing in many datasets. With the agreement of BODC and the US GEOTRACES lead PIs, BCO-DMO added standard US GEOTRACES information, such as the US GEOTRACES event number, to each submitted dataset lacking this information. To accomplish this, BCO-DMO compiled a 'master' dataset composed of the following parameters: station_GEOTRC, cast_GEOTRC (bottle and pump data only), event_GEOTRC, sample_GEOTRC, sample_bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), bottle_GEOTRC (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD (bottle data only), depth_GEOTRC_CTD_rounded (bottle data only), BTL_ISO_DateTime_UTC (bottle data only), and GeoFish_id (GeoFish data only). This added information will facilitate subsequent analysis and inter comparison of the datasets.</p><p>Bottle parameters in the master file were taken from the GT-C_Bottle_GT10, GT-C_Bottle_GT11, ODF_Bottle_GT10, and ODF_Bottle_GT11 datasets. Non-bottle parameters, including those from GeoFish tows, Aerosol sampling, and McLane Pumps, were taken from the Event_Log_GT10 and Event_Log_GT11 datasets. McLane pump cast numbers missing in event logs were taken from the Particulate Th-234 dataset submitted by Ken Buesseler.</p><p>A standardized BCO-DMO method (called &ldquo;join&rdquo;) was then used to merge the missing parameters to each US GEOTRACES dataset, most often by matching on sample_GEOTRC or on some unique combination of other parameters.</p><p>If the master parameters were included in the original data file and the values did not differ from the master file, the original data columns were retained and the name of the parameters were changed from the PI-submitted names to the standardized master names. If there were differences between the PI-supplied parameter values and those in the master file, both columns were retained. If the original data submission included all of the master parameters, no additional columns were added, but parameter names were modified to match the naming conventions of the master file.</p><p>See the dataset parameters documentation for a description of which parameters were supplied by the PI and which were added via the join method.</p>

gmd:organisationName.gmx:Anchor: Biological and Chemical Oceanography Data Management Office (BCO-DMO)

gmd:contactInstructions.gco:CharacterString: For questions regarding this resource, please contact BCO-DMO via the email address provided.

gmi:description.gco:CharacterString: PI Supplied Instrument Name: Pump surface Instrument Name: Pump surface Instrument Short Name:Pump surface Instrument Description: A source of uncontaminated near-surface seawater pumped onto the deck of the research vessel that can be sampled and analyzed. This pumped seawater supply is from an over-the-side pumping system, and is therefore different from the vessel underway seawater system. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/31/

PI Supplied Instrument Name: Perkin Elmer Lambda 35 Spectrophotometer Instrument Name: Perkin Elmer Lambda 35 Spectrophotometer Instrument Short Name:Perkin Elmer Lambda 35 Instrument Description: The Lambda 35 is a double beam UV/Vis spectrophotometer from Perkin Elmer, packing pre-aligned Tungsten and Deuterium Lamps. It has a wavelength range of 190-1100nm and a variable bandwidth range of 0.5 to 4nm. Community Standard Description: http://vocab.nerc.ac.uk/collection/L05/current/LAB20/

gmd:title.gmx:Anchor: International Council for the Exploration of the Sea
